TopicTitle: I wonder what game this guy was playing.. :) :)

Articles.Content:

We've all experienced such urge at one point or another ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif) If my look could kill, all of my computers would end as a pile of slag on the floor.

Grand tour mission, completes all in one go, returns to kerbin safely.

Forgot parachutes....
It's happening! Humans are fighting machines! The Matrix didn't lie!

Hmm... Kurtjmac did a 12 year mission to Eeloo on youtube and forgot the antenna to send back the science... And as usual he took it with a laugh. So i bet, it must have been something more...critical... Like launching a 5.000 part ship at 2 fps and no time warp - with crash to desktop the moment, when the designated 15.000 km circular orbit was achieved...
He was playing 64-bit

> 
> It's happening! Humans are fighting machines! The Matrix didn't lie!

Terminator didn't lie! Skynet!

Few years ago I had a CRT monitor which had some display issue. I had to hit it on the side to fix it. As I had to hit harder and harder to "fix" it, I managed to use **a hammer**. 

But it did quite well for few more years, before the internal grid detached...

Being in England shooting things isn't a readily available option, and anyway, if I do ever get the urge to get violent towards my machine I just remember how much money I've invested in it.

But I once got totally agri-vated with a HP printer and took a John Deere tractor to it.

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/TkRFr)
![1120officespace.gif](http://big.assets.huffingtonpost.com/1120officespace.gif)

> 
> Few years ago I had a CRT monitor which had some display issue. I had to hit it on the side to fix it. As I had to hit harder and harder to "fix" it, I managed to use **a hammer**. 
> But it did quite well for few more years, before the internal grid detached...

This reminded me of our TV we had when I was small. One day my father and I were moving it around and it slipped out of my hands (big CRT televisions were heavy, and I was like 10). It fell on the ground and a bunch of parts broke apart inside. We had about a handfull of electrodes and transistors and whatnot that just broke off. The thing was, the TV worked just fine, for years and years after that incident...

Years ago I put a notice on the company board: "Don't take it out on your computer, throw one of mine out of the window"

Part of my job at the time was conducting acceptance tests on 'ruggedised' military computers and one of those was a 2m drop onto concrete (aka; thrown out of my office window). 1 in 10 of every new batch got the treatment, whether they wanted it or not ...

... Oh, and people soon learnt not to park their cars beneath my office!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-25T23:44:53Z" title="04/25/2015 11:44  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 25, 2015</time> by Pecan**

Hardened steel multi-purpose chainsaw vs Computer casing. 

Chainsaw wins - **big time.**
He was playing I Am Bread
